abstract: Jonathan Sallet has had a hand in divisive debates in Washington, and he will draw more attention as decisions are made on net neutrality and the Time Warner Cable-Charter merger.
snippet: Jonathan Sallet has had a hand in divisive debates in Washington, and he will draw more attention as decisions are made on net neutrality and the Time Warner Cable-Charter merger.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Every day for one month last fall, Jonathan Sallet, the general counsel at the Federal Communications Commission, sneaked into a small, windowless office at the agency, its location undisclosed except to senior staff.

headline.main: Net Neutrality Again Puts F.C.C. General Counsel at Center Stage
headline.print_headline: Net Neutrality Again Puts F.C.C. General Counsel at Center Stage
